title: Genus theory, governing field, ramification and Frobenius
authors:
Roslan Ibara Ngiza Mfumu (University Marien Ngouabi of Brazzaville,
  FEMTO-ST), Christian Maire (FEMTO-ST)
authorsParsed:
University Marien Ngouabi of Brazzaville,
  FEMTO-ST
abstract:
In this work we develop, through a governing field, genus theory for a number
field $\K$ with tame ramification in $T$ and splitting in $S$, where $T$ and
$S$ are finite disjoint sets of primes of $\K$. This approach extends that
initiated by the second author in the case of the class group. It allows
expressing the $S$-$T$ genus number of a cyclic extension $\L/\K$ of degree $p$
in terms of the rank of a matrix constructed from the Frobenius elements of the
primes ramified in $\L/\K$, in the Galois group of the underlying governing
extension. For quadratic extensions $\L/\Q$, the matrices in question are
constructed from the Legendre symbols between the primes ramified in $\L/\Q$
and the primes in $S$.
